title: philip hammond plans emergency brexit budget if britain leave the eu with no deal
story: Sources said the Chancellor has been forced to shelve any major decisions he had hoped to make in this month’s Budget because of the impasse in Brexit talks.They said it effectively means the October  Budget and the Spring statement will be switched around in all-but name.The Spring Statement - normally used to publish the latest economic forecasts - would be upgraded to make it a budget-style event.It makes a mockery of Mr Hammond’s big move last year to switch the Budget back to the Autumn.But Treasury insiders say they cannot make big fiscal moves before they knowBritain is leaving the EU next March without a deal - given the huge gulf in economic forecasts between that scenario and getting a deal.The Treasury believe a no deal Brexit will require an extra £ billion more borrowing.But securing a deal at next month’s emergency EU summit would lead to a -month transition period - leaving our current trading relationship with the bloc unchanged until January .Sources said this lack of clarity would make the Chancellor’s October  Budget a non-event.And Theresa May has already pinched two of the announcements Mr Hammond had planned for the Budget.She used her Tory conference speech to announce a further freeze in fuel duty and a house building splurge.The PM also beat the Chancellor to declaring an end to austerity.These spending commitments come after the Government has already promised an extra £ billion a year funding boost for the NHS.The Budget is expected to contain “dficult” decisions on measures to pay for the costly announcements.

title: emmanuel macron stop brexit second eu referendum
story: The Prime Minister warned the rest of her ministers that the French hardline boss is holding out hope that another referendum could be on the cards.And it might push EU leaders into giving us a bad dealthey think they can force another vote where Britain opts to stay in the bloc, The Times reported.The French President is pushing for the EU to pursue a hardline approach with Mrs May in Brexit talks - and is said to be among several members who want to punish us for leaving.He told other leaders that Britains current Chequers deal wouldnt stand in the EU - and threatened to block another special summit to finalise a deal unless the PM made more concessions.The French president has warned that a trade deal with Britain cant come at the expense of the EUs integrity.But meddling Mr Macron launched an extraordinary attack on the leaders of the leave campaign during the referendum after the Salzburg summit.He branded Brexiteers as liars just hours after the EU tore apart Mrs Mays Brexit plans.And he said last month that Britain should for sure reverse Brexit because voters didnt realise how complex it would be.He denied meddling with British politics but said he would welcome the UK ing to the EU.However, Mr Macron has been using Brexit to his advantage - reportedly flying over top CEOs on private jets over to France for meetings.He has made no secret of his desire to nick British jobs after we leave, especially in the financial services sector which London competes fiercely with Paris for.Today EU boss Donald Tusk hit out at Foreign Secretary Jeremy Hunts insulting comments comparing the EU to the Soviet Union over Brexit.But he also piled pressure on Mrs May to ditch her hated Chequers plans and go for a Canada-style free trade agreement instead.

title: big ben remembrance sunday
story: London’s famous bell rang shortly after pm as a test ahead of Remembrance Sunday and New Year’s Eve.Big Ben was silenced in August last year at the start of a four-year plan to restore Westminster’s Elizabeth Tower.MP Stephen Pound, who tried to block the move, was in Parliament to hear the chimes.The Ealing North MP, who wiped away a tear as Big Ben was muted last year, said: Remembrance Sunday is a solemn occasion and the sonorous sound of the bells will certainly add to the sense of occasion.”He added: “I salute the courage of the bell master who agreed to let this happen and let the chimes of freedom ring out again over the city.”The Elizabeth Tower, home to the Great Clock and the Great Bell - known as Big Ben - is undergoing a complex programme of conservation works to safeguard it for generations to come.Parliaments team of clock mechanics temporarily disconnected Big Ben and the quarter bells from the clock mechanism and lowered the weights to the base of the tower in order to provide a safe environment for the people working in the Elizabeth Tower.A bespoke electric mechanism has been built to power the kg striking hammer in order to ensure the Great Bell can mark Remembrance Sunday and New Years Eve.Only the Great Bell - Big Ben - will strike. The quarter bells will not chime.Our journalists strive for accuracy but on occasion we make mistakes. For further details of our complaints policy and to make a complaint please click here.

title: netherlands disrupts russian cyber operation
story: Hours after the Dutch and British allegations, the US indicted seven Russian intelligence officers for conspiring to hack computers and steal data in a bid to delegitimise international anti-doping organisations.Justice Department officials say three of the seven Russian military intelligence officials were previously charged by special counsel Robert Mueller.US defence secretary James Mattis has called for Moscow to be held accountable for allegedly targeting the OPCW.Responding to the claims made on Thursday, the Russian embassy in London said the allegations were "irresponsible" and that the UK was imparting "crude disinformation".In a statement, it said: "As is traditional, it is not backed by any proof and is another element in an anti-Russian campaign being conducted by the British government."The Russian foreign ministry accused the West of "spy mania" over the latest allegations. At a news conference at the Hague, Dutch authorities showed passport pictures of four people - three cyber officers and a case officer - who arrived at Schiphol airport in Amsterdam from Moscow on  April.The four men are said to have gone to the OPCWs headquarters on a reconnaissance mission.Pictures revealed at the news conference showed the car they used with a WiFi antenna and technical equipment in its boot, thought to be used to hack the network. It was around this time that investigations into the Skripals novichok poisoning were taking place.They decided to try and destroy smartphones following their mission and also took their rubbish out of their own hotel rooms they stayed in, in an attempt not to leave any DNA traces, according to Dutch officials.They are said to have had #,and ,in cash with them. Officials said the men were expelled from the country following the alleged cyber attack. Speaking about the Russian intelligence service GRU, Mr Wilson said it was a "well-funded" unit of the Russian state and that it was behaving "aggressively across the world" and "with apparent impunity".He said the agents had planned to target an OPCW in laboratory in Switzerland too. title: you should renew your passport
story: NewsWhy you should renew your passport as soon as possible - or risk being barred from EuropeThe government has released documents that state, in the event of a no-deal Brexit, Brits "may be denied entry" to some EU countriestheir passport has less than six months until expiryShareCommentsByRobyn DarbyshireAudience Writer:,  OCT Updated:,  OCT Newsthis.style.displaynone" Video LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in CancelPlay now,adData:,videoData:,mainEntityOfPage:https:www.mirror news politics video conservative-mp-brandishes-passport-commons-,customFields:,suggestedData:,,,,,,,,,,,,,,],gtmContainerId:GTM-MTHP,gtmFbiaContainerId:GTM-PNLXFZS,trackingData:,bundledCss:,recommendations:https:mab.data.tm-awx rhs,modularCss:true,newslettersURL:https:communicatoremail F QVgiPbuQPTrjCOF~PhHv_ ,nativeAppBanner:true,info:,article:,info:],hasLeadVideo:true,interaction:,features:,bundledCss:,recommendations:https:mab.data.tm-awx rhs,modularCss:true,newslettersURL:https:communicatoremail F QVgiPbuQPTrjCOF~PhHv_ ,nativeAppBanner:true""Get politics updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailTheres been a lot of speculation about what Brexit will mean for our holidays - and plenty of us have been worried about whether well be able to travel to some of our favourite spots in Europe with the same ease were used to. Brits are now being advised they should renew their passports as soon as possibletheyre in their last year - or risk being barred from entering Europe in the event of a no-deal Brexit, the government warned on September . Ministers published documents confirming we will need to have passports that are valid for AT LEAST six monthswe want guaranteed entry into countries in the EU. That means some valid British passports will be completely useless in our neighbouring countrieswe leave without striking a deal.  Basically, the documents say that without a deal, British citizens risk being treated the same as those from outside the EU in the borderless Schengen zone. The documents state: If you plan to travel to the Schengen area after  March , to avoid any possibility of your adult British passport not complying with the Schengen Border Code we suggest that you check the issue date and make sure your passport is no older than  years and  months on the day of travel. For example,you’re planning to travel to the Schengen area on  March , your passport should have an issue date on or after  October . If your passport does not meet these criteria, you may be denied entry to any of the Schengen area countries, and you should renew your passport before you travel. These same rules apply to both adult and childrens passports - and the government recommends renewing as soon as possible as the passport issuing service can get busy.

title: arrogant selfish drink driver who
story: NewsArrogant and selfish drink-driver who killed a grandmother and seriously injured her husband jailedTraffic officers described it as an utterly avoidable collision caused by a selfish and arrogant manShareCommentsByAndrew Bardsley:,  OCT NewsSebastien Anderson, was two-and-a-half times the legal alcohol limit "Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA speeding drink-driver who ploughed into a couples car, killing a grandmother and seriously injuring her husband, was jailed today. Sebastien Anderson was two-and-a-half times the legal alcohol limit when he crashed into Pamela and John Richards Nissan Micra on February  this year. The couple, who were described as pillars of the local community, had just been to the Etihad Stadium to see their beloved Manchester City beat Leicester -.Traffic officers later described it as an utterly avoidable collision caused by a selfish and arrogant man, Manchester Evening News reports. Mrs Richards, , suffered fatal injuries and her husband John, , remains in a neuro-rehabilitation unit after Andersons VW Golf smashed into them. Anderson, , was jailed for nine years and eight months after pleading guilty to causing death by dangerous driving and causing serious injury by dangerous driving. He remained emotionless in the dock as he was sentenced by Judge Martin Walsh at Manchester Crown Court. Mr Richards was driving with his we of  years in the passenger seat. He pulled out of Bennett Street onto Hyde Road in east Manchester, a journey well-known to the couple, the court was previously told.  Anderson, who already had two previous drink driving convictions on his record and a known alcohol problem, had drunk wine before travelling on Hyde Road at around pm. The defendant accelerated on the mph road and began to overtake a taxi. It is estimated that he was travelling between  and mph when he overtook the taxi. As he did, Anderson crashed into the Richards car. When passers-by saw the collision and rushed over to help, they saw Anderson slumped over the steering well, and it was clear both Mr and Mrs Richards were seriously hurt, prosecutor Charlotte Crangle told the court on Monday. They were both taken to hospital, but Mr Richards first had to be cut out of his car.  Mrs Richards, from Flixton, Greater Manchester, was pronounced dead just before pm. Mr Richards is still in hospital, having suffered fractures to both arms, his shoulder and his neck as well as a serious brain injury. He is currently in a rehabilitation ward, and will have to move into assisted living when he is expected to be discharged in December or January due to his medical needs. It is expected he will suffer long-term cognitive and physical deficiencies. The tragedy was the latest to befall the Richards family, with John and Pamelas eldest daughter dying shortly before the crash after developing breast cancer. The court was told that Mrs Richards worked at Woolworths and was a childminder. Mr Richards was an educational welfare officer well-known for his work with young people, and had been a governor at Kings Road Primary School in Stretford. Anderson originally denied the offence and said someone  was driving the car, but later pleaded guilty. Sentencing Anderson, Judge Walsh said: The collision was caused by the dangerous way in which you drove your vehicle which was further aggravated by your grossly intoxicated condition. The sentence that I am required to pass cannot, and is not intended to reflect the value of the lives which have been lost and shattered by your actions. The grief, pain and loss experienced by the family and friends of Pamela and John Richards is enduring. The pre-sentence report indicated that you have expressed remorse for your conduct and I accept this is genuine. Putting to one side the issue of alcohol and speed, the execution of the overtaking manoeuvre alone was dangerous. Anderson must serve half of his sentence before being considered for parole. He was also disqualied from driving for a period of ten years and ten months and will be required to take an extended re-test.

title: dad 47 plans marry girlfriend
story: NewsDad, , plans to marry girlfriend despite -YEAR age gap and his daughters disowning himBruce Nelson, , from Wisconsin, USA, plans to wed -year-old nursing student Marissa Almanza despite his daughters objectionsShareCommentsByElaine McCahillRebecca Drew:,  OCT Updated:,  OCT NewsBruce Nelson, , from Wisconsin, USA, plans to wed -year-old nursing student Marissa Almanza despite their -year age gap "Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA dad, , plans to marry his girlfriend despite their -year age gap and his daughters disowning him over the union. For Marissa and Bruce, their relationship is the same as any other other without an age gap, with neither of them prepared to turn off their feelings based on someone s opinion. We met at work, he was my co-worker and I loved that he was always so kind, understanding, and had such a positive attitude, said Marissa. He quickly became my favourite co-worker and we started making plans to spend time outside of work taking the dogs for a walk, fishing, boating, and food dates here and there. Upon first meeting, we did not have the love at first sight thing because we were at work and we both werent looking for a relationship at the time.  I love his smile and his laugh, its still my favourite thing today and his beautul blue eyes. Bruce says that he was first amazed by my beautul smile and he loved my passion for le and animals. What got him was my ability to be honest in any situation and it truly blew him away even when I was in the wrong. At first my mum and dad were judgemental about it, for like a week, but they saw how happy he truly made me and how he treated me and how playful and lovey we are so they quickly changed their minds. My whole family has never been rude or judgemental to him or us, which I am so thankful for.  Bruces mum, step dad, dad, and step mum and his cousin have all been wonderful to me and open armed. The relationship was a bit rocky with his brother, but weve noticed they are finally coming around slowly but surely. We actually just picked our wedding day and plan to get hitched next year, she said. Passengers on board the easyJet flight alerted cabin crew after the woman was “acting erratically” in her seat halfway through the journey from Naples to Liverpool.The Echo reports that woman was then found to be smoking in one of the toilets. When the flight landed, all those on board were asked by the captain to remain in their seats as police would be coming on to remove the passenger.  Video footage taken on the flight shows two officers escorting the woman from the back of the plane. Once she was removed the captain thanked passengers for their patience. He said: “The passenger was removed for smoking in the toilet during the flight, putting the whole plane in danger. “Thank you for waiting while crew and police dealt with the situation.”  A witness told the ECHO: “She was shaking and moving about a lot then I seen her run to the front to the toilet. “It was full so she ran down to the back and slammed the door. “I thought she was sick at first but the cabin crew were knocking on the door and asking her to come out. Other passengers praised the flight staff for dealing with the incident so well. One man said: “They moved the lady that was sitting beside her and unless you were close to her you wouldn’t even have known something was going on.”

title: man kept squalid carlisle shed
story: NewsMan kept in squalid Carlisle shed for  YEARS with just a chair and soiled beddingPolice have said they are investigating an incident of modern slavery in Carlisle after a -year-old was found in conditions "that no human being should live in"ShareByChris Riches:,  OCT NewsAn investigation is underway after a man believed to have lived in a six-foot shed for  years was rescued by specialist officers "Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA pensioner kept a man in a shed for  years - with just a chair and a soiled duvet, it is claimed. Officials swooped on Hadrians Camp, a homeless and travellers site near Carlisle, after a tip-off about a man being kept in squalid conditions. Cumbria Police found a  year-old with learning dficulties living in the damp shed in conditions that no human being should live in. Officers have said they are investigating an incident of modern slavery. But devastated relatives of the OAP who has been arrested for allegedly keeping the man in his shed have claimed he took him in out of friendship. The man was said to be like a rabbit in the headlights when found in the shed on Wednesday and is now being medically assessed. Officers arrested a frail homeowner, , in a house next door on suspicion of modern slavery offences, although hes too poorly yet to be interviewed. But now relatives claimed the kind-hearted pensioner took the man in and offered him a place in the house - but claimed he preferred the shed. The relative, who asked not to be named, claimed: Hes a free man. Hes had everything given to him but this is how he chooses to live. My relatives home is right next door to the shed, and hes told the man hes free to go into his home any time he wants. Hes said he can sleep on the sofa, but he wont do it. This man is free to come and go as he pleases.  It is feared the man was living in the shed, working for food and shelter, since he was aged  or . Cumbria Police - who coordinated the raid alongside the Gangmasters and Labour Abuse Authority- are now investigating. Detective Chief Inspector Helen Harkins said: Our officers assisted the GLAA as part of their investigation into an incident of modern slavery in Carlisle. We would like to stress that anyone of any race or background could be a victim of modern day slavery. Offenders tend to target people who are vulnerable and isolated. We often rely on the public for valuable information and evidence when investigating these type of crimes. Hidden signs make it dficult to identy a victim, but common indications include poor physical appearance, isolation, poor living conditions, few or no personal effects, restricted freedom of movement, unusual travel times and a reluctance to seek help. I would urge people to take the time to learn the signs and get in touchyou have any suspicions that something is not quite right. The GLAA have claimed the conditions the man was allegedly forced to sleep in as those that no human being should live in. They are a government department who monitor the supply of workers to the agricultural, horticultural and shellfish industries. They work in partnership with other agencies to protect vulnerable and exploited workers and crack down on modern slavery.

title: man turns detective catch girlfriends
story: NewsRaped, strangled and strung from a tree on an Indian beach: Mans fight for justice after girlfriends murderEXCLUSIVE: Andrew Jordan has put his le on hold and vowed to stop at nothing to reveal the truth behind the murder of his "angel" Liga SkromaneShareByLiz Dunphy:,  OCT Updated:,  OCT Newsthis.style.displaynone" Video LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in CancelPlay now,adData:,videoData:,mainEntityOfPage:https:www.mirror news video andrew-jordan-loss-partner-liga-,customFields:,suggestedData:,,,,,,,,,],gtmContainerId:GTM-MTHP,gtmFbiaContainerId:GTM-PNLXFZS,trackingData:,bundledCss:,recommendations:https:mab.data.tm-awx rhs,modularCss:true,newslettersURL:https:communicatoremail F QVgiPbuQPTrjCOF~PhHv_ ,nativeAppBanner:true,info:,article:,info:],hasLeadVideo:true,interaction:,features:,bundledCss:,recommendations:https:mab.data.tm-awx rhs,modularCss:true,newslettersURL:https:communicatoremail F QVgiPbuQPTrjCOF~PhHv_ ,nativeAppBanner:true""Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA heartbroken man has turned detective to catch his girlfriends killers who raped and murdered her before hanging her body from a tree at an Indian beach beauty spot. Andrew Jordan has put his le on hold and vowed to stop at nothing to reveal the truth behind the murder of his angel Liga Skromane. The -year-olds headless body was found by a local fisherman in a swampy mangrove forest close to where she was last seen at a popular tourist beach in India. Liga had been missing for  days after travelling to a wellness retreat in the Indian state of Kerala with her sister to seek treatment for PTSD. She vanished while on a trip to get cigarettes and was last seen in a rickshaw heading to the beach on March  this year. A police investigation led to the arrest of two men who were charged with first-degree murder and rape but they have since been released on bail while a trial date is set.  Police say they confessed to meeting Liga on the beach before they lured her to the mangrove to smoke marijuana. They said that she passed out and they then repeatedly raped her. When she woke up they said they accidentally strangled her while trying to restrain her and strung her body up on the tree to make it look like suicide. But Andrew has serious concerns about the veracity of the confession and believes there are gaping holes with the theory. The haunting memory of Ligas body forever etched in his mind drives his search for the truth as he pours over hours of police documents and evidence looking for clues. The home they shared for five years is piled high with papers and news-clippings from the case and post-it notes, scribbled with stubborn questions, are stuck to the computer screen and the walls. Andrew said: “Every spare minute Im working on the case, sending emails and writing everything down, trying to piece it all together. “I think about it constantly and some questions just wont go away.  “Someone knows something over there but I have no faith in the Indian police or the justice system to find them. “My focus now is on sending out a shock wave in the international community by writing a book or making a film. “I cant let it rest. There are other victims who have disappeared or been murdered in India who have never got justice. The cases are dragged out for so many years that the families get worn down and dont have the energy or the money to fight anymore. And therell be hundreds more unless things change,” Andrew said. “I feel like Im an investigator investigating a murder with no support which happened thousands of miles away. “I have people in India updating me on whats happening on the ground there via WhatsApp everyday. “And Ive been taking extra work to make as much money as quickly as I can to get back out there so the police know Im still there breathing down their necks.”  One of the questions Andrew has about the case involves the designer Italian woollen jumper Liga was wearing when he identied her body on April . He believes that this jumper is a vital clue and one which undermines the police theory about Ligas death. He said: It was over c. You dont even need a jumper there at night. The only place you would need one there would be in a cold cellar or a fridge. The two men they arrested for her murder said that they were raping her all day but one of them then went home and got her a jumper - an expensive Italian designer jumper - when she said she was cold. If youre raping someone I think its unlikely you suddenly start caring about their temperature. Andrew has also identied problems with the official theory that Liga was killed the day she disappeared. He showed photos of the body to independent forensic scientists who told him Ligas remains were not sufficiently decomposed for her to have died where her body was found  days earlier. Andrew said: I was told that the state of decomposition looked like she had been dead for  -  days,  days at the very most.  “A forensic scientist told me thata body was left in that environment for  days, it would be in a worse state.It’s like her body had been kept in a very dry, cold place which prevented it from decomposing further. “So she must have been moved to that mangrove swamp not long before she was found. “Andshe had been there for weeks she would have been found much sooner. That area is not as isolated as police pretend. People go there to forage and to drink alcohol and take drugs. There’s a well worn path through the area and there’s a house about m away. “Someone would have seen her or someone would have smelt the bodyit really had been there for  days.”  Andrew also believes that Ligas injuries, confirmed in an autopsy, also cast doubt over the official theory that she was accidentally strangled. He said: She suffered blunt force trauma to her neck which was given as her cause of death. It tore the nerves and fractured thyroid cartilage. The severity of the injury is not consistent with the claim that she was accidentally strangled by an arm around her neck as she was being restrained. Ten of her teeth were also missing. If these teeth fell out after death as the police investigation suggests, they would have been easily recovered near her body. And the two men they have barely speak English. Theres no way she would have wilfully spent the day with them. She hated drugs and Liga was hugely considerate, she would not have disappeared for the day knowing it would worry her sister. Manoj Abraham, the Inspector General of Police in Thiruvanthapuram Range, the area where Ligas body was found, has confirmed that they will not be calling for the CBI to join the investigation. Mr Abraham said: The High Court after detailed study of the case files agreed that the investigation has been conducted on correct lines and so the case has been dismissed.  We will be charge sheeting the case in the next seven to ten days and then it is for the court to take up the trial of the case. Andrew said that he is disappointed but not surprised by the verdict. “I have no confidence in the police.Now the two guys charged have been released on bail awaiting trial. “I’d like to believe she was not suffering for long, being held prisoner somewhere before her death but I still dont know what happened to her. Now, all alone in the home they once shared, Andrew is haunted by thoughts of her final moments. Wandering around his bedroom in a daze, surrounded by Ligas clothes and books, Andrew is now trying to plot the next stage in his fight for justice. “I want to protect other girls from Liga’s fate. If lessons are not learned and the guilty are not held accountable there will be another Liga. If I can do anything there I’d like to help protect women from sexual and domestic violence. There is so little protection for them. “If I find out the truth I’ll be happy not to have to imagine what happened to her anymore, he said.

story: NewsOne in eight British men visit prostitutes and they are more likely to be middle classThe demand for commercial sex in the UK has been estimated more thoroughly than ever before in an analysis of more than , British men aged  to ShareCommentsByLucy Clarke-BillingsMark Waghorn:,  OCT Updated:,  OCT NewsA study found a strong and signicant association between buying sex and living in London "Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailOne in eight British men visit prostitutes and they are more likely to be churchgoers, middle class or regular overseas travellers, according to new research. The demand for commercial sex in the UK has been estimated more thoroughly than ever before in an analysis of more than , British men aged  to . It claims  per cent use prostitutes - well above the one in ten calculated by earlier studies. And researchers found men who paid for sex have on average  sexual partners - two-and-a-half times more than the . partners for those who do not. Study lead author Dr Marilena Locatelli, an economist at the University of Turin in Italy, said: There are more managers, professionals and skilled workers paying for sex. This is not the case for elementary occupation.  She said this was a surprise, since such men may have more to loseit becomes known they have paid for sex. Dr Locatelli said: Second, belonging to a religion has a signicant and negative effect on the probability of not having sex with a prostitute. Again, this result is contrary to our expectation. She added: An unexpected finding is that the expected number of times with prostitutes is higher among those who declare that they are religious. The findings, published in the Scottish Journal of Political Economy, are based on a mathematical model using information from the National Survey of Sexual Attitudes and Lestyles. It included  participants who said they had been with prostitutes, and , who said they had not.  Dr Locatelli and co author Dr Steinar Strom, of the University of Oslo in Norway, said there is no other similar comprehensive study of its kind. The expected number of times with prostitutes was much higher among men travelling abroad, living in London and middle rather than high or low earners. Dr Locatelli said: It could be the lower income men cannot afford having sex with prostitutes and the rich men may have too much reputation to losethey are caught being with prostitutes. Worryingly, drug users and men who do not use condoms are also more likely to have sex with prostitutes, exposing them to health risks. The researchers said from a policy point of view, it was interesting to note that the men are less likely to use prostitutesthey had an extensive sex education, which is still not compulsory in schools.  Dr Locatelli said: To require that sex education at school should be compulsory in all schools could therefore help in reducing prostitution in Britain. Moreover, we find that drugs users, and men declaring that they are religious, are more inclined to participate in the sex market. We find a strong and signicant association between buying sex and being abroad and with living in London. We find that men with medium and medium–high income, which indicates a middle class background, are more likely than other men to participate in the sex market. This ranged from pound, to pound, a year.

title: primary school teacher who leaked
story: NewsPrimary school teacher who leaked SATs answers killed herself after being warned she could lose jobKatherine Margaret Walsh, , who taught at at St Francis of Assisi Roman Catholic School in Norwich - and who once appeared TV show Deal Or No Deal - told a friend the answersShareCommentsByYasmin HarishaNeil Murphy:,  OCT Updated:,  OCT NewsKatherine Margaret Walsh was  when she died in May of this year"Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA tragic young primary school teacher took her own le after sharing SATs questions with a friend and fearing she would lose her job, an inquest heard. Katherine Margaret Walsh, was found hanged at her home by her father Denis Walsh, , in May of this year. The teacher gained notoriety locally when she appeared on the TV game show Deal Or No Deal back in , when she walked away with just p. Katherine, also known as Katie, was aged  at the time of her death and a primary school teacher at St Francis of Assisi Roman Catholic School, in Norwich. An inquest into her death at Norfolk Coroners Court heard that Katherine had managed to find out what the questions to the exams were and she had told a friend who worked at a dferent school. In a statement, Mr Walsh said: Her friend had been caught and lost her job, but she told them Katie gave her the questions and it was likely she would lose her job too.  Devastated Mr Walsh explained in the inquest, on the day of Katherines death his daughter had told people she was off work sick. Mr Walsh told the inquest how he knew to go and visit Katherines home in the morning on  May after a friend had got in touch with the family. He explained the friend had received a concerning message from Katherine during the night. Mr Walsh said: My we called me that morning asking me to check on Katie because a friend said she had messaged her to say that she loved them very much. My we had been trying to contact Katie but she was not answering, so she asked me to go. He said when he walked into Katherines home, in Costessey, Norfolk he said he screamed out her name and held her and was hysterical and in shock. He added: She left a handwritten note on the bed and told me not to blame myself. In a second note, left on her iPad, Katherine apologised to her family and friends by writing: I know what I have done is going to hurt many people but I feel like this is all I can do.  Bear in mind, I was massively depressed and feeling like this before this. Mr Walsh explained Katherine had been battling with depression for a number of years prior to her death. Mr Walsh also explained in the inquest that Katherine had been suffering from depression and had been seeing her doctor for a number of years and mentioned Katherine had tried to commit suicide in the past. title: woman who only went toilet
story: NewsWoman who only went to the toilet ONCE a week was so bloated by mystery illness that people thought she was pregnantEXCLUSIVE: Kayleigh Henning suffered from bloating, constipation and abdominal cramps for more than  yearsShareCommentsByLiz Dunphy:,  OCT Updated:,  OCT NewsKayleigh Henning suffered from bloating, constipation and abdominal cramps for more than  years, pictured here with husband Robert "Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA woman who was so bloated by a mystery illness that people thought she was pregnant is now expecting her first child after beating illness by avoiding six common foods . Kayleigh Henning suffered from bloating, constipation and agonising abdominal cramps for more than  years. Her condition was so bad she could only go to the toilet once a week. Sleepless nights were spent curled up on the bathroom floor in agony while multiple doctors failed to correctly diagnose her problem. Kayleigh said: It was so annoying because everyone just assumed I was pregnant and wouldnt leave that alone - I was definitely not pregnant! Id wear tights or anything like that which normally fit me for the whole day. By the end of the day, Id be very uncomfortable and Id have pressure marks from my trousers or tights imprinted on my skin.  “It was pretty painful, which affects you mentally. You feel like you just dont want to go out anywhere. Id often find Id experience diarrhoea on nights out and that is obviously pretty embarrassing. So many times I wouldnt feel like going out. Because I was constipated, Id be going to the toilet only once a week. That in itself is disconcerting because youre thinking in the back of your head why havent I been to the toilet . I probably endured the problems all through my s, even at university. Id been to see my GP mainly because of constipation problems and Id get given fibre gel drinks, she says. Kayleighs situation came to a head when she graduated from Heriot-Watt University, in Edinburgh, and moved from Scotland to Northern Ireland that week.  “The stress of that culminated in my first visit to AE. I was really worried I wouldnt be able to fly back for the graduation ceremony because I was in so much pain. I was just curled up on the bathroom floor, because it was cold and the best place to be.” Tiredness and depression, caused by her painful and irritable symptoms, had became part of daily le for the then -year-old.  Doctors put the symptoms down to Irritable Bowel Syndromeand prescribed a drug they thought would help. Kayleigh went home and had her first nights sleep in - days, but she developed an allergic reaction to the drug and had to rush back to AE. On most occasions [at the GP] I dont know whether it was ignorance or easiness, I always got these fibre gel drinks which I used for quite a while until another GP told me to come off them because they were not a long-term solution. But then Kayleighs personal trainer mentioned food intolerances and said she could fast-track an elimination diet with a test which analyses IgG antibody reactionsto up to  food and drink ingredients provided by the company YorkTest . Kayleigh said: My trainer was intolerant to a few things and didnt know until she took the test. Since she has eliminated those things from her diet, she has felt so much better.” Kayleighs husband, Robert, has ME [chronic fatigue syndrome] and was also going through a rough time but couldnt understand why. Kayleigh says: Hes had a few allergy tests, but never any intolerance tests. He had already eliminated gluten and cows milk from his diet. His lunch consisted of a chicken breast, potatoes and an egg every day.  “Interestingly when he took the intolerance test, which I got for him as a Christmas present, he found he was intolerant to eggs! So as soon as he eliminated the eggs he felt better as well.” Although Robert had around  intolerances, from eggs to raspberries, the message from specialists was not to panic - and even that some intolerances can be reintroduced six months after eliminating them from a diet. Kayleighs test - the YorkTest FoodDrink Scan programme - also threw up several surprises, revealing she had reactions to cow’s milk, egg white, lentils, yeast, buckwheat and gluten. “I’m not surprised by cow’s milk or gluten and avoided them as much as possible, because I knew that they didnt agree with me. I was surprised by lentils - I loved making lentil soup and sweet potato and lentil stew - and of course lentils are seen as healthy,” she says. My borderline list had things like walnut, rhubarb and avocado, which I ate all the time as well. What the experts advise is to eliminate everything over a period of six months then you can start to reintroduce things. We dont necessarily do that, but we can enjoy things on occasions and not suffer because were not eating them every day. The test involves sending a finger-prick blood sample to a laboratory for analysis followed by up to two consultations with a nutritional therapist.  Kayleigh says: “I found the nutritional consultation very helpful. Particularly when it came to finding alternatives, especially for garlic! “She was able to provide much more specic information on what to avoid based on food groups and gave some great alternatives and recipes,” she says. As soon as Kayleigh started her elimination diet, she immediately felt better. “As I had already removed gluten, wheat and cow’s milk from my diet, I found it relatively easy to remove the remaining foods. The one I found most dficult was yeast. “I definitely feel much better, and I know when I have eaten something that I am intolerant to immediately. I havent been constipated since, I bloat much less, and I don’t experience the same stomach cramps, provided I steer clear of my trigger foods. I do eat the odd food I probably shouldnt, but at least I know the reason for any discomfort. I am so much happier, consistently comfortable and have regular bowel movements, too.

story: NewsFlight MH: Eight unsolved mysteries exposed by experts who suspect a cover upThe Malaysia Airlines flight vanished with almost  passengers and crew as it flew from Kuala Lumpur to BeijingShareCommentsByChris kitching:,  OCT Updated:,  OCT Newsthis.style.displaynone" Video LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in CancelPlay now,adData:,videoData:,mainEntityOfPage:https:www.mirror tv tv-news video mh-final-moments-recreated-,customFields:,suggestedData:,,,,,,,,,],gtmContainerId:GTM-MTHP,gtmFbiaContainerId:GTM-PNLXFZS,trackingData:,bundledCss:,recommendations:https:mab.data.tm-awx rhs,modularCss:true,newslettersURL:https:communicatoremail F QVgiPbuQPTrjCOF~PhHv_ ,nativeAppBanner:true,info:,article:,info:,],hasLeadVideo:true,interaction:,features:,bundledCss:,recommendations:https:mab.data.tm-awx rhs,modularCss:true,newslettersURL:https:communicatoremail F QVgiPbuQPTrjCOF~PhHv_ ,nativeAppBanner:true""Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid Email A group of aviation experts has blasted the official report into the disappearance of flight MH, saying it was flawed and Malaysia didnt try to get close to the truth.The experts have poked holes in the report and uncovered eight key areas where more action or information is needed from the countrys government. The Malaysia Airlines flight vanished with almost  passengers and crew as it flew from Kuala Lumpur to Beijing in March . It remains one of aviations biggest mysteries, with few pieces of debris found and the exact reason it went off course still unknown.  In their official report, Malaysian officials concluded that they were unable to determine the real cause of the Boeing -s disappearance. British aviation expert Don Thompson and fellow specialist Mike Exner, from the US,have accused Malaysia of failing to faithfully and diligently pursue the investigation. They claim the probe “was heavily politically influenced, and delayed”, and have called on the countrys leaders to reveal more about what they havent told the public.In an interview with the West Australian, the pair, from the Independent Groupof experts, explained eight areas where Malaysia needs to do more or reveal more information.. New radar data analysis  Mr Thompson and Mr Exner say the most important step would be a new analysis of radar data for the missing plane. They said: “The Safety Investigation Team has failed to provide any useful analysis of data from the military radar. “It is important to establish , when and where descents climbs did occur and what impact that would have on fuel endurance and other implications. “Of course, there are the somewhat incredible statements about Indonesian and Royal Thai Air Defence Surveillance radar assets not detecting the Boeing  in the northern Straits of Malacca.” . Complete analysis of debris  The experts have called for a complete “structural analysis of the most signicant debris items” that have been found in the sea or on islands in the Indian Ocean. Underwater searches ended with no traces of the plane. But debris that has washed up includes a flap and flaperon from one of the aircrafts wings. The experts want a closer look to be taken at the damage to the parts. . Recovery of all debris found so far  The debris that has been found so far in Indian Ocean territories hasnt been collected and stored in one place. Madagascar has a piece of the engine in its possession, while other parts were found on the French island of Reunion and the coast of Tanzania, for example. The experts say the debris should be taken to one place so it can be examined all at once for further clues. . Comprehensive oceanographic analysis This would take a look at the drt modelling for each of the debris items before they were found. Mr Thompson and Mr Exner believe there is plenty more work to be done in this area. The exact location where the plane entered the ocean is still not clear. . Review of what happened at MAS HQ  The immediate response of state-owned Malaysia Airlines and the government have been under intense scrutiny in the years following the disappearance. Mr Thompson and Mr Exner say there should be an investigation into what happened inside the airlines operational dispatch centre. The review should look at why the flight operations officer flight dispatcher was so misinformed for such a period of time, they said. . Analysis of air audio recordings Air traffic control ground-air recordings usually offer many clues or explanations in an aviation disaster. The experts have called for a categorical attributing of the ATC ground-air recordings involving MH. They want the voices in the recordings to be identied as there is still some contention over the crew member speaking during radio transmissions. . Review of aircraft engineers role

title: haunting photos reveal life inside
story: NewsHaunting photos reveal le inside Nazi PoW camp caught on film by British soldier with camera hidden in BibleThe images were captured by Terry Hunt - his fate is not known but the photos survived in an album compiled by fellow prisoner of war David CourtneyShareByAdam Aspinall:,  OCT NewsThe burial of a British prisoner who was shot by German guards "Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailTo the German guards, PoW Terry Hunt would have seemed a devout man of faith, seldom seen around the squalid, overcrowded camp without his holy Bible. If they had known a camera was hidden inside that Bible and that he was taking these incredible pictures of le inside Stalag Luft IVB, Terry would almost certainly have been executed. His ultimate fate is unknown but the images he took survive in an album compiled by fellow PoW David Courtney. In one shot, French prisoners bow their heads in prayer at a church service, while another shows row upon row of tents that were home to many of the , inmates near Muhlberg in Saxony. At the funeral of a British serviceman who was executed, possibly for trying to escape, a dozen German soldiers are pictured firing their rles in a respectful salute over the airman’s coffin – despite being responsible for his death.  On a more light-hearted note, another photo shows a group of men all dressed – convincingly – as women for a theatrical prodshyshyuction staged to keep up morale in the camp. But for Russian PoWs there was precious little to laugh about. One photo captioned “swap shop” shows Brits exchanging unwanted food for cigarettes, while starving Russians rummage through empty cans for food. Russians are also seen queuing to get soup from the British prisoners, one holding out his cap for potato peelings.  Terry Hunt had been a film cameraman before the war and went on RAF sorties to make newsreels. He was dressed as an RAF sergeant in case he was ever captured, which he was after his plane was shot down. The album includes a picture of him with the covert camera, perhaps taken by Courtney, who was in the RAF’s  Squadron when his Halax bomber was shot down near Berlin in January . Stalag IVB opened in September  and when it was liberated by Soviet troops in April , there were about , inmates, , of them British.

story: NewsMan roundhouse kicks pro-le campaigner as she peacefully protests at anti-abortion rallyMarie-Claire Bissonnete - who claims she is often spat at, pushed and kicked during demonstrations - was in Toronto, Canada, when she was assaultedShareCommentsByLucy Clarke-Billings:,  OCT Updated:,  OCT Newsthis.style.displaynone" Video LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in CancelPlay now,adData:,videoData:,mainEntityOfPage:https:www.mirror news video pro-choice-campaigner-suddenly-kicks-,customFields:,suggestedData:,,,,,,,,,,,,,,],gtmContainerId:GTM-MTHP,gtmFbiaContainerId:GTM-PNLXFZS,trackingData:,bundledCss:,recommendations:https:mab.data.tm-awx rhs,modularCss:true,newslettersURL:https:communicatoremail F QVgiPbuQPTrjCOF~PhHv_ ,nativeAppBanner:true,info:,article:,info:],hasLeadVideo:true,interaction:,features:,bundledCss:,recommendations:https:mab.data.tm-awx rhs,modularCss:true,newslettersURL:https:communicatoremail F QVgiPbuQPTrjCOF~PhHv_ ,nativeAppBanner:true""Get daily news updates directly to your inboxSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA pro-choice campaigner suddenly kicks a pro-le protester at an anti-abortion rally in this shocking clip.
